bduDataSetFileReader Class Reference
[Utility Classes and Functions]

#include <bduDataSetFileReader.h>

Inheritance diagram for bduDataSetFileReader:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

The bduDataSetFileReader class is a light-weight dataset file reader.

Destructor. Internal memory is freed.

Member Function Documentation

bool bduDataSetFileReader::isFileOpen (   )  const
 

Returns:
true if file open, otherwise false

int bduDataSetFileReader::getNumberOfVariables (   )  const
 

Description:
Returns the number of variables found in the file opened. Returns 0 if the file is not opened successfully, or empty.

Returns:
number of variables in file

int bduDataSetFileReader::getNumberOfSamples (   )  const
 

Description:
Returns the number of samples found in the file opened. Returns 0 if the file is not opened successfully, or empty. Each variable will have this same number of samples.

Returns:
number of data samples in file

float bduDataSetFileReader::getSampleDurationInSeconds (   )  const
 

Description:
Returns the duration of samples, in seconds. The samples are presumed to have a fixed sample rate. Returns 0 if the file is not opened successfully, or empty.

Returns:
duration of samples, in seconds

const float* bduDataSetFileReader::getSamplesForVariable (  int  var_index  )  const
 

Description:
Returns the samples for a particular variable.

The variable is identified with an index from 0 to the number of variables - 1. The returned value is a pointer to a float array of sample count length. Returns NULL if the file was not opened successfully, or empty, or if the var_index is out of range.

Parameters:
[in] var_index - index of desired variable
Returns:
pointer to data of sample at given index

const char* bduDataSetFileReader::getVariableName (  int  var_index  )  const
 

Description:
This function returns the name of the variable at the given index.

Parameters:
[in] var_index - index of desired variable
Returns:
name of variable at given index
